website_summaries.verdict: Easy to clean and operate, this sleek appliance opens most cans and satisfies most needs. The best deal for a good price.

customer_reviews.title: Safety concerns with metal shavings!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 2 years ago. At first it was awesome but what I started noticing overtime were metal shavings on my counter after opening cans. Upon further investigation, I noticed lots of metal shavings and discontinued using it for safety reasons. I wouldn't want anyone in my family including the dogs to ingest metal shavings. Definitely would not buy this product for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AT FIRST, BUT PERFORMANCE WANED TO USELESS.
customer_reviews.text: At first, this worked very well. Before it was in use for six months, fine threads and flecks of metal started to appear, both on the opener and the can. Some would fall into the food. I carefully cleaned the debris that clung to the opener, but that did not prevent flecks from inside the can. Eight months after purchase, it would no longer reliably open half the cans cleanly. If anyone has had this replaced this under warranty, I'd appreciate hearing about that experience.
customer_reviews.author: C's PurchasesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The best Can Opener ever..
customer_reviews.text: I'm 72 years young and this is the BEST can opener i've ever owned or operated.!! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Cord length is ~26 inches
customer_reviews.text: The cord is ~26in long, and can be stored inside the unit itself. Reviewers who said it has a short cord probably did not pull it all the way out. I thought the same based on the reviews I read when I received the opener. But upon reading the manual, it shows a picture of storing the cord on page 5. Then I realized that the cord was not pulled out all the way. Fairly easy to use, and makes a clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: B.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: It’s the worst I have ever had; after 6 months of trying to get it to open a can; well sometimes it does and most times it doesn’t. Horrid product
customer_reviews.author: harpsounds

customer_reviews.title: I hold my breath every time I use this. Will it or won't it?
customer_reviews.text: I have had this can opener for over a year. Doesn't always open all cans. Very frustrating when that happens. Now what? It will not open any can with even the slightest ding near the top, and all too often will not open average cans period. I have to resort to my old hand operated can opener more often than the price of this should require. I would not purchase again. EDIT: Less than 2 years later, this will not open any cans - ever. The can spins around just fine, the (alleged cutter) etching a little jagged line around the edge, but the lid is still firmly attached when done. I actually hate this thing. Garbage bound.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby's Girl

customer_reviews.title: slivers of metal get into the food if a can rotates more than once
customer_reviews.text: Danger: Can Opener puts metal slivers in food! The instructions reveal that slivers of metal come into the food if a can rotates more than once. Are you kidding me? This is a fatal flaw. Especially given that this is through NORMAL use and not extreme use. Food with metal in it is dangerous. When I called Cust Svc, the woman was non-chalant about this and was bureaucratic (to say the least). She didn't know her manager's name. Amazon should NOT sell this.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I usually love Hamilton Beach products
customer_reviews.text: We tried opening several different cans, and each time, this did not cut all the way through the can. Sending it through a second time leads to metal shards in the can, if you manage to get it to cut all the way through. I usually love Hamilton Beach products, but this one was a serious disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME appliance -- works perfect.  Electrical cord IS long enough but hidden inside.  Just pull it out!  A+++
customer_reviews.text: My wife has some had issues and was really struggling to open cans with a traditional hand opener. I looked up reviews and and this one got mostly good. One concern (I think) was about the short power cord -- I thought so to UNTIL I REALIZED the cord is HIDDEN inside the case -- just PULL it out however far you need it. Doh! Sure it's in the manual but who reads those eh? Anyway, my wife LOVES this thing and it works perfectly every time. A+++
customer_reviews.author: UW85

customer_reviews.title: It works if you read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: The instructions clearly read - "do not make multiple revolutions or metal shavings may appear." Go around your can one time and disengage when you hear a frequency change (higher pitch.) Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P. Childs

customer_reviews.title: Great Can Opener!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great can opener. Took a minute to figure out how to fit the can and realize it opens the cans from the side and not the top. I soon realized what a benefit this is! NO sharp edges and you can snugly fit the top back on the can for refrigerator storage if you don't use the entire can of food. Very sturdy and easy to use. There is an option to lock the handle down if you don't want to hold it while it's opening the can, but its not difficult either way.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L

customer_reviews.title: More Than A Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: My family has went through several can openers over the last 16 years. So far this one exceeds all of the others. For starters this can opener doesn't stop at removing the inside can top, it removes the entire can top. The can opener removed the top from the outer lip. It also works small cans as well as the larger can. Now we can buy the larger cans of fruit and open them without effort. This can opener is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tamula9

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this or any Hamilton Beach product
customer_reviews.text: This can opener has never worked. It doesn’t even cut into the can or turn the can. It just grinds above the metal making shreds everywhere. Unfortunately I missed the Amazon deadline to return it so tried to contact Hamilton Beach both by phone and on their website and there has never been any response. Although it’s still under warranty, that is of no value when you have no way to contact the company to file a warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: SaVVyShoPPer

customer_reviews.title: Will be throwing it in garbage
customer_reviews.text: I was mad at myself for not writing a review sooner ... everything has been super great with this can opener and I wanted people to know about it. HOWEVER ... recently, metal shavings started showing up and one ended up in my finger. NOT GOOD! I wonder how many shavings have ended up in my food - or my dog's food! It's time to get another can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Metal splinter in my finger.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the high average of reviews and, in a hurry, failed to read at least a few of the negative ones. As with other negative reviewers, it left a metal splinter in my finger. That happened on first use and Amazon's customer-focused return policy should provide a quick refund.
customer_reviews.author: jmr

customer_reviews.title: Easy, clean, and you won't cut your hand.
customer_reviews.text: No downsides; simple to use by just placing the can under the bar and pushing the top leaver down. When the can is open there are no sharp edges to poke or cut your hand. So far I have not found any food debris to clean up after.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Neubert

customer_reviews.title: Huge problem with imperfect cans
customer_reviews.text: This can opener seemed to work well enough at first but then started stalling on any imperfection in a can. Most of the cans I get are not perfect and this opener just can't get the job done if there are any dings, dents, flat spots along the rim of the cans. When the opener stalls out, I find a bunch of metal shavings inside the cans. I'm not going to pay shipping both ways to mess with the warranty on a $29 item. I put it in the trash can and went back to using my 10 year old can opener. It takes a huge dent to stop that thing and it never leaves metal debris in the cans.
customer_reviews.author: Pitchegru

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and Love this can opener! Super easy to use just lift up and push down, and NO SHARP EDGES!
customer_reviews.author: Darkfiremn1

customer_reviews.title: The can opener was great for the first two months
customer_reviews.text: The can opener was great for the first two months. Then the can opener would not open can anymore. I contacted the company about warranty and was told I would have to pay 11.50 for shipping on the warranty replacement. Which sounds OK but why should we have to pay for shipping on a product that did not even last out the warranty. These companies don't sell quality products or stand behind the products they sell. We as consumers are the one that seem to be held accountable not the manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach can opener.... almost perfect, except for...
customer_reviews.text: This countertop opener makes a criss, clean, and smooth opening. Easy to use. Accommodates taller cans, and cans of most any diameter. Except... the power cord is a mere 9-inches long, so we are stuck with it jammed up against an outlet, and using it in the middle of a counter-top cooking project requires a -- dropcord (drumroll, please)!
customer_reviews.author: just being Frank

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously flawed product
customer_reviews.text: The instructions warn the user not to cut more than once around the can, because this may produce sharp surfaces. However, cutting more than once on at least part of the can is virtually inevitable. This is a side-cutting device, rather than a top-cutting device. The cutting takes place on the side away from the user, completely obscured by the body of the device. The user cannot see where the cutting begins or ends, so cutting past the starting point is almost guaranteed. The cutting does not stop automatically. On two successive cans the result was a can and/or lid with wickedly sharp shavings on the edges.
customer_reviews.author: California consumer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance on most cans.
customer_reviews.text: While it works very well for most cans, we've had problems with some cat food and tuna cans. For those you have to put your hand underneath and make sure the top edge of the can stays in contact with the round bar as it is rotating. The smooth edges of the both the lid and the can after opening is a big safety plus.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DeGroot

customer_reviews.title: I find it simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: ...but others do not. I guess people are stuck on "classic" style openers, and when they approach it, they have a hard time understanding it. Aside from having folks not understanding the use of the opener, I do have a single concern-I almost always see at least 1 fine piece of steel on the lid as I remove it. I have not seen this gossamer thread of steel IN my food at all, but it's something I keep an eye on as I use this several times per week. I think the newer design is great, it looks good, and a removed lid that leaves neither a sharp edge on the lid nor the can is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product in October of 2015 when wrist arthritis made using my beloved hand held non-electric opener impossible. Worked well ~ wonderfully well, in fact ~ until April of 2017, and now regrettably it has given up the ghost at a time when I am well stocked with pet products requiring opening. After only a year and a half? How is this possible? Is this really how long we should expect things to last? And why on earth would I want to repurchase this item? AND it is $10 higher in price than a year and a half ago. Shoot me now!
customer_reviews.author: Marie H. Girard

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electric can opener I've ever owned. It's smooth, easy to use and it cuts the entire top off of a can (not just the lid). The only thing I DON'T use it for is opening cans of tuna. I use my OXO SteeL Can Opener (from Amazon) for tuna cans because I like to use the lids to squeeze down into the can to help drain all the tuna juice out of, which I give to our cats. Every other can gets a ride in this electric can opener and it works flawlessly. It's FAST, it's relatively quiet, compared to most other electric can openers, it's easy to clean and it stays sharp. HIGHLY recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Big

customer_reviews.title: Love this opener
customer_reviews.text: Best can opener I have ever owned. I did not know that these existed and have been fighting with the "dirtiest inch in my kitchen" for years. This cutter does not enter the can, but cuts a fine line at the top of the can. The cut is smooth and there is no danger of cutting yourself on the raw edge. Unlike other can openers you do not have to remove the blade and fiddle with it to get it back on. Will be telling all my friends about this one!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK
customer_reviews.text: This can opener works about as well as any other, I suppose. It opens by cutting just below the rim of the can rather than inside the rim. While this does result in a smoother cut, it's messy. If the contents are very liquid, it's hard to get the can disengaged from the opener without spilling liquid everywhere. Additionally, with some products, like canned tuna for example, I like to drain out some or all of the liquid before completely removing the lid. Cut this way, that is not possible. I have used it too many times to return, so guess I'll just write this one off for experience and buy another, more traditionally functioning opener.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of electric can openers thru the years. I have mobility and hand issues and this can opener has been such a blessing to me. It's easy to use and I love how you lift the lid from the sides instead of from the top. I also can use it on the flip top cans they are making now that I couldn't open with my fingers. I've purchased many expensive can openers that seem to only last about a year, and I don't abuse them. I will stick to Hamilton Beach products in future.
customer_reviews.author: Rev Evans

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: My wife hurt her hand and is in the process of getting it back to normal. She had trouble opening cans and asked me for something that would help her in the kitchen. I got this for her based on the reviews. She used it last night and it worked perfectly for her. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Bak9

customer_reviews.title: Useless Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a rating below zero I would. I have had this can opener for less than a month. I have tried to open approximately 10 cans with it and only one opened completely. With most cans it would't even start opening them, and with a few others it operated for about an inch and spewed metal shavings all over the top. I am returning it. Don't waste your money or time on this.
customer_reviews.author: MLToo

customer_reviews.title: Actually fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this can opemer. I don't know why I didn't get this sooner. It actually makes opening cans fun, weird I know. It effortlessly spins the can and LOCKS it in place so you don't have to worry about it falling off and going everywhere when the lid comes off. That's another thing, the LID comes off, not a huge gouge in the top of it. I don't know how it does it, but it literally pops off the top as if it was from the factory. I'm very happy with this, and I know you will be too. This is 100% worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not Traditional
customer_reviews.text: It was very frustrating (for me) to use this opener. Over many decades I have used many can openers, from Boy Scout openers, Swiss Army knives, those with a handle and a point that you leverage down, another type with handles that open, then you squeeze them shut, clamping a round blade that you move with a kind of key. This opener, basically, is very simple - once you figure it out. (Yes, read the directions!) It's certainly not intuitive for me. I finally "got" it, then forgot the next day what to do. Now I know (I hope). This opener will probably be easy for younger people who aren't handicapped by past physics.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Forrest

customer_reviews.title: works well, no ribbon chip problems
customer_reviews.text: Since you have to hold down the start lever on the top of the machine, if you pay attention to the label as the can goes around you can stop the device a bit beyond the start position and avoid and ribbon slivers of metal some reviewers note. I have yet to see such. I like that, in theory you can replace the can lid on the can for short term refrig storage, eg black olives or such. Opener cuts the lid off horizontally just below the top of can seam and this allows the lid to be replaced on the can in a stable position that seals the can and doesn't slide off in ordinary handling.
customer_reviews.author: sch

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a couple of years. It worked great at first but started having problems opening larger cans (large dog food cans) and I had to hold the can out at the bottom to get the top opened and now it is leaving metal shavings on the can. IN the can, around my black counter top making it nearly impossible to see. I am now buying a NEW can opener
customer_reviews.author: Dawna Kern

customer_reviews.title: Second Fail. Design Flaw.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed I had to return it. Because I loved the design and ease of use of this can opener so much that after the first one malfunctioned after only six months I figured it was a fluke and ordered a second one. NOPE, the second one failed after one week!! As other reviewers have noted, it suddenly becomes unable to engage with the can at all. Spins around leaving tiny strands from the top of the can. I experimented to see if it was perhaps just one type of can but it consistently failed. If they could fix this design flaw they’d have a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Chiaro

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed. Little "Hairs" of metal shed as you open cans of food with it.
customer_reviews.text: Problem trusting it as it sheds very fine little "hairs" of metal when opening a can. I can't think little strands of metal are good in your food!
customer_reviews.author: Customer several years

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended :/
customer_reviews.text: The product works, but not as well as expected: It will often need to go around the can 2 or 3 times to get the lid off and it doesn't lock in place -- you need to hold it down over the can. I do love that it cuts the lid off in its entirety without touching your food -- that is a HUGE bonus -- but I asked my husband what he would rate it since he uses it the most and he gave me the star quality as well as review. He suggests browsing for a different product, based off of his personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Slivers of metal and eventually very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This can opener was fine at first. However, I think a can opener should last a long time. Others may be willing to replace such things, but I am totally annoyed. I have a different one 20 years old (traditional electric opener), still working and then this one. I have to press a can into the blade for 5-10 rotations and once the lid is finally off, there are leftover slivers of metal falling. I can't use this for food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener with a sleek look
customer_reviews.text: Great can opener and a sleek look that goes well with my stainless. This is a side cutter opener and does a neat job of cutting off the lid with no sharp edges. I have owned several electric can openers of the traditional top cut type and have never been very satisfied. Usually after a few months the did not cut well or dropped cans. I just started buying manual openers. I decided to try this since it was a different design and see how it holds up. I do not know what the longevity will be, but it is the initially best can opener I have ever used. Only time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Recorder

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for barely a year before it could no longer open any can period. Another cheap material made product that won't last for a while
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Orndoff

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely positives about this product - like the way it opens the top of the can leaving no sharp edges and doesn't require lot of pressure to work it. My only issue is that I can't leave the can opener to run on it's own. With the more traditional auto openers, you can hook the can into the opener and walk away - and there is a magnet to hold the lid and a mechanism to hold the can. With this one, you have to continuously push on the mechanism to open the can. Not a big deal - we are talking about seconds, but is taking a little time to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Tiny strands of metal on sides of opened cans
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing several electric can openers on Amazon I decided to go with this one with great reviews. The side opening feature was not a top priority for me however. It was to replace an older top opener that had seen it's last can. So imagine my surprise when I noticed tiny strands of metal on my food can as I was about to pour the contents into my saucepan! I will be sending this particular one back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: GinaP

customer_reviews.title: Looks sleek, only one flaw
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Works well. I guess I was expecting something like my old electric can opener I had growing up. You know, you put in the can, it holds it while the can spins around and then automatically stops when it's done and a magnet holds the top. Well, this one is different. It cuts the top from the side (so it creates a reusable lid) but you have to hold it down thre entire time. Having to hold the can and depress thre handle the entire time may sound petty, but I guess I was expecting more. It's not new technology. Pros: looks cool. Cuts from the side. Cons: you gotta manually hold it the whole time
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it was supposed t/b easy for seniors (or arthritic people) to use, so I bought it for my mother. I tested it out b4 giving to her ... it is terribly hard to work .... you have to keep pressing the lever down hard to keep the can opener working. And, really the cord from the unit to the wall is about 6 inches! Give me a break! ... they couldn't spare a bit more cord? I gave my mom my can opener and this one is totally useless of her. I am keeping this one until I get another can opener ... and, it won't be this model!
customer_reviews.author: DWS

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAN OPENER
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing about this easy-to-use can opener that I don't, like. Compared to my almost 20-year old previous one, this is perfect. It takes just a very light touch-and-hold on the top lever to start the opener, and of course the can stays connected by itself even after the lid is cut. The whole top of the can is smoothly removed, so I believe it's quite safe even for small children. Best can opener i've ever tried. Would love to see more colors though.
customer_reviews.author: G. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Lousy can opener
customer_reviews.text: Electric can opener that is supposed to cut the can from the side, a “safety” can opener. It doesn’t cut the cans well, leaves little metal ribbons as it tries o cut the can open, often doesn’t get the can open. How can Hamilton Beach get an electric can opener so wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Dollar

customer_reviews.title: Is anything made right anymore?
customer_reviews.text: Total waist of time and money. I used this can opener only a few times and now it seems to be stripped already after minimal use. Cans won't turn completely, gets stuck, won't budge, and I wind up using a hand-crank opener out of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Meanee

customer_reviews.title: Good can opener, despite having to hold down the control lever
customer_reviews.text: Good electric can openers are hard to come by, but this one does a good job, and I like the way it disconnects the lid without producing a sharp edge on the lid or the can itself. I just wish I didn't have to hold the control lever down the whole time it's working. Traditionally, electric can openers just require you to start them, then they'd go through the process and stop without further assistance. I'm not sure why this ubiquitous feature was excluded from this product, but it's slim pickins with the other product options available today. So, I don't regret getting this can opener, and I recommend you get it too.
customer_reviews.author: J-Pop

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this can opener for quite a while. I have a diabetic dog and shes supposed to get a bit of food in her after every insulin shot. I found it easiest to give her some canned chicken 2x a day with each shot. Basically I open 4 cans every other day. Ive probably opened over 200 cans of chicken alone and to date its working just as good as it did from day one. No slipping and blade still remains sharp and a clean cut every time. Also because the blade cuts around the edge of the top rather then penetrating the top of the can it never touches the food. Its still spotless clean.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Works Every Time!
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with several hand held openers for years and hated every single one! The worst was the rechargeable that never made it all the way around even one can! One day I went to Amazon out of frustration and found this can opener. I LOVE it! It works every time, cans attach easily and I’m almost disappointed now that so many cans are pop-top! I will check for the metal shavings that a couple of recent reviews mention, but until then, I couldn’t be happier with a can opener!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: the ultimate can opener.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this device for a few months now. It seems to be the *ultimate* can opener. It cuts the rim of the can, not the top. This is much better technology. The lid, once removed, can be replaced on top of the can so that the remaining can's contents can be put in the fridge for later use. This is the feature I like best. Another feature I like is that the opened can has no sharp edges on it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Wantz

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands so I need an electric opener. This one is far superior to the Cuisinart model I was replacing. It’s easy to get the can locked into place, it works smoothly & swiftly to open the can, and no sharp edges are left. It is sturdy and I expect will last for a long time. Well-priced, too.
customer_reviews.author: Smith Mt Deb

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this can opener years ago. It lasted well and opened tons of different cans. When it died I searched for another. I found the same opener I had. It was a no brainier, I bought it again. The only difference is the price wen up a little. t works the same as my old one my only hope is that it last as long as the first one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Burazin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: A great find at Amazon and the best product! Love the safety and design of this product. ave been using safe sharp less can openers for a while but since I have symptoms of carpel tunnel syndrome I decided to find and electric one. Did research and finally found it at Amazon. Recommend to anyone with carpel tunnel syndrome, what a delight to open cans!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Safety hazard & poor design & functionality
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice. But the 1st time I tried, I ended up slashing my index finger open from prying the lid off the can. The 2nd time, it only opened 1/2 of the can and I had to use a knife & fork to lift up (see the video). It also shaves the metal. This is an awful product. Amazon won’t accept a return because it has been 6 weeks since I bought it and we were away on vacation for 2 weeks right after we received this. I can’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: Metal shavings are a serious problem.
customer_reviews.text: I am also experiencing metal shavings, as others have stated. This can opener would only open the normal size cans, never the smaller 8oz cans. And would always leave metal shavings while doing so. Sometimes falling inside the can if you're not careful. Now, after a few months of use, it will not open any size cans. Just spins and shaves off metal splinters.
customer_reviews.author: John Hertel

customer_reviews.title: Effortless
customer_reviews.text: Whether you are weak, arthritic, or just plain lazy, this is worth getting. Keep in mind that if you do not have a convenient, easy to store space, this might take up some of your valuable counter space. The manufacturer does caution that you should stop cutting once you've gone 360 degrees, or run the potential risk of small metal filings. The can will stay attached regardless. It's easy to tell when it has gone 360 as the noise will change. This is NOT a big deal, but thought you should be aware of this caution.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 99

customer_reviews.title: OK except for metal shavings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 5 years ago and it finally died today. I had metal shavings like the other reviews so I would never use it on anything that I could't rinse. If I couldn't rinse what was in the can, I used my manual opener. Sometimes it wouldn't open the entire can and you had to go back over it. I wouldn't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: I love this can opener, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these can openers, and one for a gift. I love the smooth edges and the fact that you can use the lid to cover the can. BUT, after the can opener has been used for awhile, it starts cutting off fine metal filings that can potentially get into your food. I do wish that Hamilton Beach would get this issue fixed. I have noticed that I am not the person who has had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: RRR

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: This can opener is so easy to use. Just hold the can up to the bar and press down. It automatically starts. Remove the lid-you can't cut your hand because of the way the lid comes off - you have to lifr it off. I empty the can, then turn it over and let the appliance remove the other end. Then step on the can to flatten it so it doesn't take up so much room in the waste basket. Also, the cord is tucked inside - pull out only as much length as you need so the whole cord is not laying all over the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Clark

customer_reviews.title: Makes opening cans so much easier
customer_reviews.text: I have had several hand held side-opening can openers and I struggled with them quite a bit. They were especially hard to use on small sized and tuna cans. This can opener was just what I needed to remove the frustration of opening cans. I have used it on small diameter, tuna, 15 oz tomato, and pull-tab dog food cans. It has worked well on all of them. I just use a dish cloth to wipe the blade and the area around the blade--all clean. Due to it's small size and light weight, it is easy to store in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed in a reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: I've used this brand for many years, so this product is a horrible disappointment. It worked fine for the first couple of weeks and just a few minutes ago I threw away 3 full cans of vegetables that didn't open, but the metal was sliced up so the cans are then rendered useless. I also got two slivers of metal stuck in my hand that were a real picnic to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: D. V. Squires

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: The Hamilton Beach electric can opener does not work! It does not hold the can - and I tried several cans in different sizes - and it does not turn the can in order to open it. It is really a pain to buy something and then have to return it. I called Hamilton Beach but they said I had to return it where I bought it. No interest in inadequacy of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Good product...bad plug
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I really like the fact that you can cut the cans so easily, and with no rough edges. Depending on what it is, even put the top back on for storage. The only problem is the cord is super short. I had to prop mine up on a little pedestal. If just plugged in it just hangs there like a limp....it just hangs there! Lol was a present " happy Wednesday" for my husband and he liked it so it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! I have developed arthritis in my wrist and can no longer use a manual can opener. This one is perfect for me, and is super easy to use. The plus is the fact that it opens cans from the side, leaving smooth edges -- no more jagged sharp tin can lids! The only drawback is that it does not open all cans. Most, but not all. That, and it is difficult to drain the water from a can of tuna. Looks like I'll have to get a drainer for that chore, and thankfully, I know I can rely on Amazon for that, too!
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Score!Shove that cord back inside itself!
customer_reviews.text: I am truly embarrassed about just how long it has taken me to replace my Pampered Chef manual can opener, but hey, we’re all friends here, right?! Yeah, so It’s been so long...how long has it been? blah blah blah..., but seriously, it’s taken more than 10 years and I’m happy to announce that THIS this is the one. I haven’t regretted this purchase and am still wondering why I waited so long!🤷‍♀️ My (grown) kids were flabbergasted at Thanksgiving when I pulled this beauty out of its special place in my kitchen. I love this because the cord can be shoved back into the innards(vivid, yes?)and put away, easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnysgirl22

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: We loved the can opener until it quit opening cans on Thanksgiving. The drive gears turn but do not grab the can or cut the metal around the top. We had another brand that that opened cans the same way. That one lasted 4 years. This one lasted just a few months. There are no replacement parts that I can find on the Hamilton Bend site or anywhere else on line or at a local parts store. I am not impressed with the longevity of this one.
customer_reviews.author: SD Oma

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money On This Opener.
customer_reviews.text: After just a few months, today I am donating this can opener to the Goodwill. It has been a pain in the neck to get the cans open. It will work on one and then the next it will not work at all. I have had better luck than my husband, who is an engineer and can do just about everything needed in our home. When it works it is great, but that isn't all the time. I will go back to an old hand opener that works every time. Don't waste your money on this opener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy on hands.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a can opener easy on my hands and with a small foot print. I tried a compact battery operated can opener that fit in a drawer but it was a waste of money... awkward to use, unreliable, loud. This Hamilton Beach Smooth Touch (76606ZA) is so easy to use. The lever on top requires minimal pressure to operate. It is powerful and sturdy yet small and lightweight enough to move from inside cupboard to counter top with ease. Also runs so much quieter than battery operated. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TeaJay

customer_reviews.title: Opens cans easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a great can opener. I have a 20 year old Krups Open Master which still works, but it was a bit tricky to get started on the can, and my wife hated it. I loved the bladeless type opener like the Krups that doesn't rip open the top of the lid, so I was very glad to find this can opener which opens cans in a similar manner, but works soooo much better and easier than my old Krups. It's easy to use, and the color blends in so much nicer with our kitchen compared to the white color of our old opener.
customer_reviews.author: James Evans

customer_reviews.title: Best can opener ever !
customer_reviews.text: I have owned all kinds of can openers including electric, battery operated, hand held, etc. Believe me when I tell you that this is the best there is. It opens the cans on the side of the top so there is no worry about the lid cutting you when you pick it up. There are no sharp edges because it cuts on the side of the can. Even if you have one of the tabs on the top of the can break off this will still open the can. It is so quick and easy I wish I had bought it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Best can open or you will ever buy
customer_reviews.text: This as they best can opener I have ever found. It is side cutting and cuts very smooth. You can lift it up to cut larger cans as well. It is worth the little extra cost to not have issues with the can opener anymore. I even bought one for my elderly mother who has issues with her hands and it is perfect for her.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, quiet and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I dreaded having to replace my old faithful, over 15-year-old B&D can opener when it finally fell apart but am delighted with this Hamilton Beach. The fact that it cuts around the side of the can makes opened cans really easy to handle There's no fussing to pierce the can top to get it started and it is suprisingly quiet. I do recommend following the instruction from other reviewers to stop the process as soon as the can has made one full revolution. This easy to do because the sound changeswhen the cutter hits the already-opened spot.
customer_reviews.author: Giraffe Lover

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE A DREAM........
customer_reviews.text: It was time to purchase a new electric can opener after the old one started to act up. So glad we chose this one after checking availability of same item. This looks nice, black one, sitting on the counter as it waits to do what it is made to do. It does a great job, no spilling as it lets go of the can. All around a good purchase because it easily does its job. So glad we picked the right one. Thanks Amazon, its just what we needed! This is a good product so don't hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: pinecone

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach (76606ZA) Smooth Touch Electric Automatic Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying two. It cuts the can, any size for me so far, from small cat food cans to large cans, at the top seam. Opens up easily and the lid can be used to seal the same can for refrigeration. People complain about slivers. The slivers will ONLY come about, if you go around the can a second time. Listen for the can cutting, and when the pitch goes higher, stop at once, as you are 100% around the can. Of the 100s of cans I've opened, not ONE failure. Best can opener I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: kids_bus_driver

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Can Opener, and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and kids were using a couple of big and bulky hand operated can openers for as long as we've been a family, and that's been a very long time, as my son is almost 30! lol. So, I'm on Amazon before Christmas and knew that he would most likely like it, not just for him but for a couple of the kids. It may not be the biggest, shiniest, with all the bells and whistles, to bout. It's very plain looking and it's just one feature, and that's to open cans, and they do it very well!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This can opener looks good and opens cans differently
customer_reviews.text: This can opener looks good and opens cans differently. It doesn't have the sharp edges on the lid but it also doesn't separate the lid easily from the can. I've found it hard to get the top off and have spilled soup a number of times trying to do so. It doesn't attach and hold the lid magnetically like my old can opener. At this point I'd rather have an old style can opener with it's ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Fun Driver

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT OPEN CANS
customer_reviews.text: Do not know if the device I received was defective, or the green bean cans are make of Kevlar, but it will attach to can, spin about an inch and stop. One time I got a can open by starting and stopping it until I got all the way around, but other efforts were not successful. Will return and try another product.
customer_reviews.author: Suedoc

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic can opener! It’s well-made, works well, and looks great! I have purchased for myself as well as for other members in my family. We all like it. It’s great that there are no sharp edges, and it lasts. I’ve had mine for several years, and it is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: lllmmm

customer_reviews.title: Opens cans easily and without slicing your hand!
customer_reviews.text: This can opener is the Rolls Royce of can openers. My dog gets a can of green beans every night as a bedtime snack (it's weird, but she loves them) and I have tried a multitude of hand operated can openers over the years. They start out ok, but eventually they stop working very well and I end prying open partially opened cans, slicing my hands open, etc. Well no more! This bad boy takes a can, locks it in and rips it open in less time than it takes to swear at my old can opener. Plus my hands stay slice free!
customer_reviews.author: APS

customer_reviews.title: Great for people who need to save half a can of vegetables or soup.
customer_reviews.text: Great can opener. When you open the can, you can use the opened lid to cover the contents again if you only use part of the contents. My last one didn’t last as long as I felt it should have before it stopped opening the lid completely, and I was frequently forced to go around a number of times until it finally came free. However, I liked it enough to buy another one in hopes that it lasts longer. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Great Working Opener and has been in 2 years of use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little late writing this review in that I've had and been using this can opener for about 2 years. However, when something works even better than you expect and continues to do that for a period of time, it should be recognized. This opener does open cans but does it extremely well cutting just below the can's rolled edge so you lift off the top just like a lid. Not once in 2 years of use has it failed to give a clean perfect cut. Never have had to struggle with a lid that the opener didn't quite make a clean cut all around as experience with other openers I've used.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN in CA

customer_reviews.title: doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: didn't work, bought for my parents for x mas and it didn't open can as it is supposed to Contacted Amazon, but I am past my return window as of 1/31/2019 now I have to contact Hamilton Beach to see what they will do. $25 can opener. You get what you pay for. Just sucks losing $25
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Can Opener Ever - 😊👍
customer_reviews.text: Well I must clarify that title! It is the best can opener I ever had! It is so easy to use and cuts the cans perfectly; no sharp edges! I love it and very happy I got it. I will be buying a couple for presents the next time I see them on sale! I highly recommend the Hamilton Beach Smooth Touch electric can opener. I am sure you will be happy with this one! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Buckerou

customer_reviews.title: Best Can Opener I Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of my other electric opener because it was a pain to use and always needed cleaning. Now my hands are no longer up to using the manual kind, so I bought this one, hoping it would be better than the old electric one. I was VERY pleasantly surprised by how well it works. It leaves a clean, NOT-sharp edge, and is very easy to deal with. I have yet to see any metal shavings from it, and I'm pretty careful. You DO have to listen carefully to know when it is finished cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Cleopatra

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This can opener works like a charm. I bought it when I knew I was going to have two carpal tunnel surgeries two weeks apart. This can opener is very easy to use. Like many newer types, it opens just below the top seam, so you don't get sharp lids, a bonus. You can tell when the can is opened because the sound changes. Seems to be substantial, sturdily built -- yet attractive. Completely satisfied.. An improvement over the older types of electric can openers.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Vasicek

customer_reviews.title: Sanitary, no sharp edges, brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY can opener you should own. All others I've seen, pierce the can ... which leads to potential sharp edges, but even worse, tiny buildup of food debris on the can piercing/cutting V - which is a of bacteria source, introduced into the next can. This gem cuts the side rim of the can, never touching the food. Simply - brilliant - design (and handsome). One tiny drawback, my last one only lasted 25 years. This could be the last can opener you'll ever buy ... Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Anvik

customer_reviews.title: Works great with no sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: I watched a video on one of the reviews before purchasing this product. I have had a hard time finding usable can openers that will last. I bought this one awhile ago and use it constantly. It's so easy and I love that it doesn't leave any sharp edges. Great quality, works just as well as when I first used it.
customer_reviews.author: shellrl

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this can opener at first......
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this can opener at first, but it grew on me over time. It opens cans in a different method & I wasn't expecting that, so I immediately didn't like it. After a few uses, I noticed that when my cans are open, there is no way to get cut on the edge. Somehow it cuts off the entire tip of the can, not just cutting an interior ring. (It is hard to explain, but if you've ever used one like this, then you know what I am saying! LOL.)
customer_reviews.author: prettymissjamie

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend saving your money.... Do not buy! The can opener worked for all of 6 months. I cleaned the blades as recommended, and was able to use it another month. Then it would only work on certain cans. I loved the design of product, but it does a poor job opening cans.
customer_reviews.author: HhGBHG

customer_reviews.title: Read lower reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is our second try, after our first purchase it would only open 1/2 the cans that we tried. With all of the positive reviews we thought that we had a lemon, so we exchange it for the same. Well same results, only open certain type cans. We will keep this unit as when it works it works nice, we are buying and hand opener to go with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: Larry Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Quit opening cans after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a month and then it quit opening cans. Motor will turn but it doesn't open cans anymore. Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but very good, cleans easy.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent can opener so far. It doesn’t work perfectly on every can, but it is at the 95% success level. Position of can as you hold it seems critical to success. Once you do several cans, success level goes way up. Sort of a feel thing. Cleaning is super easy, no blade to dull or cut yourself like old ones that were also hard to clean. I would recommend it, and would buy it again if it quit working. No sharp edges after opening.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ehrnst

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful can opener
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these as a gift a six years ago. It has always worked perfectly. I recently bought one for a friend and he loves it too. I do not keep mine on the countertop (I like my countertops uncluttered), but he does and it is a nice looking can opener.
customer_reviews.author: queenbee

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: loved the style the small foot print for counter Unfortunately it DID NOT WORK I let it go around 3-4 times and the cutter didn't get anywhere near the cop of the can to open it in any way Not only would it not open cans, it would just slice just enough metal off the top of the can to make the lid a health hazard that would cut anyone to come in contact with it Had to return it I was really hoping my hands would get a brake but it wasn't meant to be
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: An awful can opener
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove pop off lids. Ir worked okay the first couple of time then it didn't! I shreds the metal, takes numerous rotations to remove the lids but even after going around several times, it doesn't always remove the lid. It doesn't even work well on regular cans and leaves little piles of metal shavings on the counter. If I hadn't thrown out the box, I would have returned it. I wish I could give it 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JSS

customer_reviews.title: Electric can opener
customer_reviews.text: Finally bought an electric can opener! As a senior citizen, my hands were not holding and turning the hand opener well anymore. This one takes off the lid from around the can and has no sharp edges. It's simple to use and works well every time. When it had gone all the way around, the noise changes slightly so I know when it's done and can remove the can from the opener. Taking the lid off is simple and safe. Highly recommend this product. I should have bought one 45 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Latin teacher

customer_reviews.title: Leaves no sharp edges because it cuts under the rim! Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this electric can opener! It has made my life so much easier! I have limited use of my hand and using a regular can opener was not only painful, but frustrating in how difficult it had become! So happy I purchased this one in particular as it opens a can under the lid/rim so there are no sharp edges. Super fast and easy to use! I would buy it again...and again!
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this opener feels hefty, looks to be of good quality, is compact and therefore takes up little counter space, and the cord being retractable does not wind all around your counter so it keeps things looking neat. The other point about possible sharp edges from over-rotating the can, it's a simple as stopping as soon as you hear the change in sound of the lid finishing being cut open. It's not difficult to hear the difference, so just let up on the handle/lever and you're done...clean cut. I recommend this opener - like my headline says, it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kong

customer_reviews.title: A must-have can opener!
customer_reviews.text: If you've had can openers skip over portions of the lid requiring you to use a case knife to pry open your can while making a strenuous effort not to cut yourself; then this absolutely is the can opener for you. My wife has purchased so many can openers only to have them work initially then begin performing poorly at completely opening cans. Not this one; it cuts on the upper outside of the can (not puncturing the top with metal inserting into the food) and this one takes the lid off cleanly. A kitchen and cook lover's dream appliance!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. Kizzie

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach (76606ZA) Smooth Touch Electric Automatic Can Opener with Easy Push Down Lever, Opens All Standard-Size and Pop-Top Cans,Extra Tall, Black and Chrome
product_meta.description: Style Name:Smooth TouchThe Hamilton Beach smooth touch can opener easily opens both pop-top and regular cans with the slightest effort with just one hand. You never have to worry about sharp lids when you use this can opener. That's because it cuts cans along the side, leaving you with a smooth, touchable lid. The sleek, stylish black and chrome design complements any kitchen decor and looks great on every countertop. This automatic can opener performs well and looks great.
feature_bullets: This can opener will easily open all standard-size cans and cans with pop-top lids

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars20,797 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
